$schema.title: Schema declaration
$schema.description: Optional JSON Schema identifier that helps tooling discover compatible vocabularies.
$schema.$comment: Format and serialisation §format: documents MAY declare $schema for tooling introspection.

$version.title: Document version
$version.description: Semantic Versioning identifier for the token document per Architecture and model §versioning.

$extensions.title: Document extensions
$extensions.description: Namespaced metadata that applies to the entire document per Format and serialisation §$extensions.

$overrides.title: Overrides
$overrides.description: Conditional overrides evaluated in order per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

token-members.title: Token member map
token-members.description: Tree of design token or collection entries keyed by names that do not begin with $.
token-members.$comment: Architecture and model §tokens-and-collections: document members other than $-prefixed metadata are tokens or nested collections.

pointer.title: DTIF pointer reference
pointer.description: JSON Pointer string optionally prefixed by a relative path or HTTP(S) URI with a fragment per Format and serialisation §$ref.

allOf.$comment: RFC 6901 pointer grammar with mandatory # fragment (Format and serialisation §$ref).
External references MUST use relative paths or HTTP(S) URIs, so absolute and network-path references are invalid (Format and serialisation §$ref).
Directory traversal segments ../ at the start of the path are invalid (Format and serialisation §$ref step 1).
Directory traversal segments ../ inside the path before the fragment are invalid (Format and serialisation §$ref step 1).
Percent-encoded or mixed-encoding .. segments such as %2e%2e/, %2e./, or .%2e/ are rejected (Format and serialisation §$ref step 1).
Percent-encoded or mixed-encoding .. segments after directory boundaries are rejected (Format and serialisation §$ref step 1).

local-pointer.title: Local JSON Pointer reference
local-pointer.description: JSON Pointer fragment that targets the current document per Metadata §metadata.

allOf.$comment: Metadata §metadata: $deprecated.$replacement is a JSON Pointer and must target the current document.

reference.title: Pointer alias
reference.description: Object aliasing another token via $ref per Token types §value.
reference.$comment: Token types §value: alias objects contain only $ref and MUST resolve to the same $type.

$ref.title: Alias target
$ref.description: Pointer to the referenced token per Format and serialisation §$ref.

nonEmptyArray.title: Non-empty array
nonEmptyArray.description: Array containing at least one candidate per Token types §value fallback semantics.
nonEmptyArray.$comment: Token types §value: fallback arrays MUST provide at least one entry.

colorReference.title: Color literal or alias
colorReference.description: Inline colour payload or $ref alias per Token types §color and Format and serialisation §$ref.
colorReference.$comment: Token types §color: $value entries MAY embed literal colour objects or $ref aliases that resolve to the same $type.

dimensionReference.title: Dimension literal or alias
dimensionReference.description: Inline dimension measurement or $ref alias per Token types §dimension and Format and serialisation §$ref.
dimensionReference.$comment: Token types §dimension: $value entries MAY embed literal measurements or $ref aliases that resolve to the same $type.

fontDimensionReference.title: Font dimension literal or alias
fontDimensionReference.description: Font-specific length measurement or $ref alias per Typography §font-dimensions and Format and serialisation §$ref.
fontDimensionReference.$comment: Typography §font-dimensions and §font-face: values MAY embed inline font measurements or alias another token with the same $type.

lengthDimensionReference.title: Length dimension literal or alias
lengthDimensionReference.description: Length measurement or $ref alias per Token types §dimension (length) and Format and serialisation §$ref.
lengthDimensionReference.$comment: Token types §dimension: length measurements MAY be serialized inline or referenced via $ref.

angleDimensionReference.title: Angle dimension literal or alias
angleDimensionReference.description: Angle measurement or $ref alias per Token types §dimension (angle) and Format and serialisation §$ref.
angleDimensionReference.$comment: Token types §dimension: angle measurements MAY be serialized inline or referenced via $ref.

css-ident.title: CSS identifier
css-ident.description: Identifier matching the CSS <ident> or <dashed-ident> grammar per CSS Values and Units §css-identifier-syntax.
css-ident.$comment: MUST conform to CSS <ident> / <dashed-ident> productions including Unicode escapes (css-values-4, css-syntax-3).

css-family-name.title: CSS family name
css-family-name.description: Font family string following the CSS <family-name> grammar per CSS Fonts Module Level 4 §font-family-names.
css-family-name.$comment: Typography §font and §font-face: fontFamily, family, and fallback strings MUST follow the CSS <family-name> production allowing quoted names or sequences of <ident> tokens.

anyOf.description: Quoted CSS <string> production allowing escaped characters.
anyOf.title: Quoted family name

anyOf.description: Unquoted sequence of one or more CSS <ident> tokens separated by ASCII whitespace.
anyOf.title: Unquoted family name

text-decoration-shorthand.title: Text decoration shorthand
text-decoration-shorthand.description: CSS text-decoration shorthand accepting line, style, colour, and thickness components per Typography §text-decoration and CSS Text Decoration Module Level 4.
text-decoration-shorthand.$comment: Typography §text-decoration: serialised strings MUST follow the CSS text-decoration grammar, including named colours, system colours, calc()/var() functions, and <length-percentage> thickness values.

text-transform-list.title: Text transform list
text-transform-list.description: Whitespace-separated sequence of text-transform keywords per Typography §text-transform and CSS Text Module Levels 3-4.
text-transform-list.$comment: Typography §text-transform: values MUST be composed of recognised keywords (for example none, uppercase, full-width, full-size-kana, or math-* variants), CSS global keywords, or custom property references via var().

platform-identifier.title: Platform-qualified identifier
platform-identifier.description: Lower-case dot-separated identifier prefixed with css, ios, or android per platform-qualified token members.
platform-identifier.$comment: Token types §cursor, §filter tokens, §opacity, §duration, §z-index, §motion tokens, Typography §font, and §font-face require css/ios/android-qualified identifiers for context selection.

namespaced-function-identifier.title: Function identifier
namespaced-function-identifier.description: Lower-case identifier optionally namespaced with dot-separated segments for CSS and platform functions.
namespaced-function-identifier.$comment: Token types §value, §filter tokens, and §easing use function identifiers aligned with CSS grammars and vendor-qualified variants.

context-identifier.title: Rendering context identifier
context-identifier.description: Lower-case identifier describing rendering surfaces such as css.box-shadow or ios.layer.
context-identifier.$comment: Token types §shadow tokens, §gradient tokens, and §elevation tokens use dotted identifiers that mirror CSS and native surface nomenclature.

type-identifier.title: Token type identifier
type-identifier.description: Registered DTIF $type or vendor-defined identifier per Format and serialisation §$type.
type-identifier.$comment: Format and serialisation §$type: registry types include border, color, component, cursor, dimension, duration, easing, elevation, filter, font, fontFace, gradient, line-height, motion, opacity, shadow, strokeStyle, typography, and z-index. Vendors MAY mint additional identifiers and SHOULD namespace them (Extensibility §extensibility) but the schema accepts any dot-separated ASCII identifier without whitespace.

metadata-members.title: Metadata members
metadata-members.description: Optional metadata fields defined in Metadata §metadata applied to tokens and collections.

$description.title: Description
$description.description: Human-readable explanation preserved for design intent per Metadata §metadata.
$description.$comment: Metadata table: $description is optional free-form text.

$extensions.title: Extensions
$extensions.description: Namespaced metadata preserved by consumers per Format and serialisation §$extensions.

$deprecated.title: Deprecation metadata
$deprecated.description: Boolean indicator or replacement pointer per Metadata §metadata.
$deprecated.$comment: Metadata table: $deprecated MAY be a boolean or an object with $replacement.

$replacement.title: Replacement token pointer
$replacement.description: Pointer to the successor token that MUST resolve to the same $type per Metadata §metadata.

$lastModified.title: Last modified timestamp
$lastModified.description: RFC 3339 date-time recording governance actions per Metadata §metadata.
$lastModified.$comment: Metadata table: $lastModified establishes the lower bound for $lastUsed.

$lastUsed.title: Last used timestamp
$lastUsed.description: RFC 3339 date-time capturing usage telemetry per Metadata §metadata.
$lastUsed.$comment: Metadata table: $lastUsed MUST NOT precede $lastModified and requires $usageCount > 0.

$usageCount.title: Usage count
$usageCount.$comment: Metadata table: $usageCount records adoption and pairs with $lastUsed when greater than zero.

$author.title: Author
$author.description: Contributor name without leading or trailing whitespace per Metadata §metadata.
$author.$comment: Metadata table: $author MUST be a non-empty trimmed string.

$tags.title: Tags
$tags.description: Unique classification strings free of surrounding whitespace per Metadata §metadata.
$tags.$comment: Metadata table: $tags MUST be an array of trimmed, unique strings.

$hash.title: Hash
$hash.description: Stable identifier without whitespace for change tracking per Metadata §metadata.
$hash.$comment: Metadata table: $hash MUST be non-empty and contain no whitespace.

override-core.title: Override rule members
override-core.description: Shared override members applied to $overrides entries per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

$token.title: Target token
$token.description: Pointer to the token being overridden per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

$when.title: Override conditions
$when.description: Context map describing when the override applies per Theming and overrides §$overrides.
$when.$comment: Override contexts MUST declare at least one condition per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

propertyNames.$comment: Condition keys MUST be non-empty strings.

$ref.title: Override reference
$ref.description: Pointer to the replacement token per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

$value.title: Inline override value
$value.description: Direct replacement that MUST satisfy the overridden token's $type per Theming and overrides §$overrides.
$value.$comment: Inline override values must conform to the target token's $type.

$fallback.title: Fallback chain
$fallback.description: Single fallback object or array evaluated when primary override resolution fails per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

fallback-entry-core.title: Fallback entry members
fallback-entry-core.description: Shared fallback members evaluated when overrides fail per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

$ref.title: Fallback reference
$ref.description: Pointer to an alternate token per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

$value.title: Inline fallback value
$value.description: Inline fallback that MUST conform to the overridden token's $type per Theming and overrides §$overrides.
$value.$comment: Fallback values must conform to the overridden token's $type.

$fallback.title: Nested fallback
$fallback.description: Optional nested fallback chain evaluated when this entry fails per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

$value.title: Token value
$value.description: Design decision payload whose shape depends on $type per Token types §value.
$value.$comment: Token types §value: $value MUST follow the grammar associated with $type.

$value.title: Non-empty $value array
$value.description: Array values MUST provide at least one entry per Token types §value.
$value.$comment: Token types §value: fallback arrays and composite lists MUST contain at least one item.

propertyNames.$comment: Conformance §conformance-classes and Extensibility §extensibility: only the schema-defined $slots member is permitted among reserved names.

override.title: Override rule
override.description: Contextual substitution entry evaluated against $when conditions per Theming and overrides §$overrides.

fallback.title: Fallback chain
fallback.description: Single fallback entry or ordered array evaluated when primary overrides fail per Theming and overrides §$overrides.
fallback.$comment: Theming and overrides §$overrides: $fallback MAY be a single entry or an array processed sequentially.

fallbackEntry.title: Fallback entry
fallbackEntry.description: Single fallback candidate containing a $ref or inline $value per Theming and overrides §$overrides.
fallbackEntry.$comment: Theming and overrides §$overrides: fallback entries mirror override semantics.

allOf.$comment: Fallback entries MUST declare either $ref or $value.
allOf.title: Fallback resolution requirement

then.$comment: Fallback entries using $ref MUST NOT also declare $value.
Fallback entries using inline $value MUST NOT also declare $ref.

node.title: Token or collection node
node.description: Tree node that is either a token or a collection per Architecture and model §tokens-and-collections.

collection.title: Token collection
collection.description: Object without $value whose non-reserved members are tokens or collections per Architecture and model §tokens-and-collections.

allOf.$comment: Collections remain valid without child tokens as long as they omit $value; metadata-only collections support migration scenarios.
Collections do not declare $type because they do not provide default typing for nested tokens.
Collections cannot alias other nodes; only tokens use $ref.

token.title: Design token
token.description: Object declaring either $value or $ref along with optional metadata per Terminology §token and Format and serialisation §$ref.

dimensionValueEntry.title: Dimension value entry
dimensionValueEntry.description: Literal measurement, alias, or computed expression per Token types §dimension.
dimensionValueEntry.$comment: Token types §dimension and §value: dimension tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

dimensionValueFallback.title: Dimension fallback list
dimensionValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of dimension values evaluated per Token types §value.
dimensionValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

dimensionTokenValue.title: Dimension token value
dimensionTokenValue.description: Dimension literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §dimension.
dimensionTokenValue.$comment: Token types §dimension: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

fontScale.description: Whether the value scales with the user's font settings.
fontScale.$comment: When true, MUST follow Dynamic Type (IOS-DYNAMIC-TYPE) and Android scale-independent behaviour (ANDROID-DP-SP).

unit.$comment: MUST conform to CSS <length> or <percentage> (css-values-4) or native point/density-independent units (IOS-POINTS, ANDROID-DP-SP).
MUST conform to CSS <length> or <percentage> (css-values-4) or native point/density-independent units (IOS-POINTS, ANDROID-DP-SP).

fontScale.description: Whether the value scales with the user's font settings.
fontScale.$comment: When true, MUST follow Dynamic Type (IOS-DYNAMIC-TYPE) and Android scale-independent behaviour (ANDROID-DP-SP).

unit.$comment: MUST conform to CSS <length> or <percentage> (css-values-4) or native point/density-independent units (IOS-POINTS, ANDROID-DP-SP).

fontScale.description: Whether the value scales with the user's font settings.
fontScale.$comment: When true, MUST follow Dynamic Type (IOS-DYNAMIC-TYPE) and Android scale-independent behaviour (ANDROID-DP-SP).

lineHeightValueEntry.title: Line-height value entry
lineHeightValueEntry.description: Ratio, font-dimension, alias, or computed expression per Typography §line-height.
lineHeightValueEntry.$comment: Typography §line-height and Token types §value: line-height tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

lineHeightValueFallback.title: Line-height fallback list
lineHeightValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of line-height values evaluated per Token types §value.
lineHeightValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

lineHeightTokenValue.title: Line-height token value
lineHeightTokenValue.description: Line-height literal, alias, or fallback list per Typography §line-height.
lineHeightTokenValue.$comment: Typography §line-height: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

line-height.title: Line height value
line-height.description: Unitless ratio or font-dimension measurement describing baseline spacing per Typography §line-height.
line-height.$comment: Typography §line-height: value MUST be a non-negative ratio or font-dimension measurement.

oneOf.description: Ratio multiplied by fontSize to compute baseline-to-baseline distance.

value.description: Non-negative font-dimension magnitude for line height measurements.

colorValueEntry.title: Color value entry
colorValueEntry.description: Literal colour payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §color.
colorValueEntry.$comment: Token types §color and §value: color tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

colorValueFallback.title: Color fallback list
colorValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of colour values evaluated per Token types §value.
colorValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

colorTokenValue.title: Color token value
colorTokenValue.description: Color literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §color.
colorTokenValue.$comment: Token types §color: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

colorSpace.$comment: MUST be a CSS <ident> naming a colour space defined by CSS Color 4 or registered via @color-profile (css-color-4).

components.$comment: Channel order, ranges, and optional alpha MUST follow CSS Color 4 for the referenced colour space (css-color-4).

alpha.$comment: Optional fallback alpha matching CSS <alpha-value> semantics (css-color-4).

components.$comment: Known CSS Color 4 spaces listed by DTIF require three channels with optional alpha.

cursorValueEntry.title: Cursor value entry
cursorValueEntry.description: Literal cursor payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §cursor.
cursorValueEntry.$comment: Token types §cursor and §value: cursor tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

cursorValueFallback.title: Cursor fallback list
cursorValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of cursor values evaluated per Token types §value.
cursorValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

cursorTokenValue.title: Cursor token value
cursorTokenValue.description: Cursor literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §cursor.
cursorTokenValue.$comment: Token types §cursor: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

cursorType.title: Cursor context identifier
cursorType.description: Platform-qualified cursor context such as css.cursor, ios.uipointerstyle, or android.pointer-icon.
cursorType.$comment: MUST identify pointer contexts defined by CSS cursor grammars, UIKit UIPointerStyle APIs, or Android PointerIcon classes (e.g. css.cursor, ios.uipointerstyle, android.pointer-icon).

oneOf.$comment: String values MUST conform to the CSS <cursor> production (css-ui-4#propdef-cursor) or name native pointer styles/icons published by UIPointerStyle and PointerIcon.
Object values MAY encode structured pointer metadata (for example UIPointerStyle.shape or PointerIcon hotspots) and MUST follow the platform APIs they reference.

parameters.$comment: Optional parameters supply reusable inputs such as hotspot coordinates or referenced tokens consumed by pointer APIs.

font-weight-string.$comment: String weights MUST conform to CSS <font-weight-absolute>, <font-weight-relative>, or <font-weight-range> productions (css-fonts-4).

font-style-string.$comment: Font style keywords MUST match CSS font-style grammar, optionally supplying an oblique angle (css-fonts-4, css-values-4).

font-variant-string.$comment: Font variant sequences MUST match CSS font-variant grammar (css-fonts-4).

font-stretch-string.$comment: Font stretch values MUST match CSS <font-stretch-absolute> grammar (css-fonts-4).

fontValueEntry.title: Font value entry
fontValueEntry.description: Literal font payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §font.
fontValueEntry.$comment: Token types §font and §value: font tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

fontValueFallback.title: Font fallback list
fontValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of font values evaluated per Token types §value.
fontValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

fontTokenValue.title: Font token value
fontTokenValue.description: Font literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §font.
fontTokenValue.$comment: Token types §font: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

fontType.title: Font resource identifier
fontType.description: Platform-qualified font provider such as css.font-face, ios.uiFont, or android.font-resource.
fontType.$comment: MUST identify platform context and asset source using dot-separated identifiers aligned with CSS Fonts src descriptors, UIKit UIFont APIs, or Android font resource/typeface loaders.

family.title: Font family
family.description: Family name following CSS <family-name> grammar or platform catalog registrations.
family.$comment: CSS Fonts §font-family-names and Typography §font require CSS <family-name> strings or platform catalog identifiers.

fallbacks.$comment: Fallback stacks MUST preserve order and reuse CSS <family-name> grammar and generic family keywords (css-fonts-4) so they align with platform catalog registrations (IOS-FONT-CATALOG, ANDROID-FONT-FAMILY).

style.$comment: MUST conform to CSS <font-style-absolute> grammar (css-fonts-4); angles MUST follow <angle> (css-values-4).

oneOf.$comment: Numeric weights MUST follow the 1..1000 range defined by CSS Fonts (css-fonts-4).

fontFaceValueEntry.title: Font face value entry
fontFaceValueEntry.description: Literal font-face payload, alias, or computed expression per Typography §font-face.
fontFaceValueEntry.$comment: Typography §font-face and Token types §value: fontFace tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

fontFaceValueFallback.title: Font face fallback list
fontFaceValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of font-face values evaluated per Token types §value.
fontFaceValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

fontFaceTokenValue.title: Font face token value
fontFaceTokenValue.description: Font-face literal, alias, or fallback list per Typography §font-face.
fontFaceTokenValue.$comment: Typography §font-face: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

src.$comment: Entries MUST correspond to CSS @font-face src descriptors (css-fonts-4) and map to bundled/downloadable font resources registered through iOS font catalogs and Android font resources (IOS-FONT-CATALOG, ANDROID-FONT-FAMILY).

url.title: Font resource URL
url.description: Relative or absolute URL compatible with CSS url() and native font registration APIs.
url.$comment: Font URLs MUST resolve to resources used by CSS url() and native registration APIs (css-fonts-4, IOS-FONT-CATALOG, ANDROID-FONT-FAMILY).

format.$comment: Font format hints MUST match CSS src format() descriptors (css-fonts-4).

tech.$comment: Technology hints MUST align with CSS src tech() identifiers (css-fonts-4#font-tech-values).

local.title: Local font name
local.description: Local font reference matching CSS src local() <family-name> grammar and platform catalogs.
local.$comment: Local font references MUST match CSS src local() <family-name> grammar and platform catalog registrations (css-fonts-4, IOS-FONT-CATALOG, ANDROID-FONT-FAMILY).

fontFamily.title: Font family
fontFamily.description: Family name following CSS <family-name> grammar or platform catalog registrations.
fontFamily.$comment: Typography §font-face requires CSS <family-name> strings or platform catalog identifiers (css-fonts-4, IOS-FONT-CATALOG, ANDROID-FONT-FAMILY).

oneOf.$comment: Numeric weights MUST follow the 1..1000 range defined by CSS Fonts (css-fonts-4).

fontStyle.$comment: MUST conform to CSS font-style descriptor grammar (css-fonts-4); oblique angles map to the slnt variation axis per UIFontDescriptor.AttributeName.variations and Typeface.Builder#setFontVariationSettings (IOS-FONT-VARIATIONS, ANDROID-FONT-VARIATION).

fontStretch.$comment: Stretch keywords MUST follow CSS <font-stretch-absolute> grammar (css-fonts-4).

unicodeRange.$comment: Ranges MUST conform to the CSS unicode-range descriptor grammar (css-fonts-4).

fontDisplay.$comment: Display strategy MUST use the css-fonts-4 font-display keywords; native runtimes map these hints to preload/async policies.

typographyValueEntry.title: Typography value entry
typographyValueEntry.description: Literal typography payload, alias, or computed expression per Typography §typography.
typographyValueEntry.$comment: Typography §typography and Token types §value: typography tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

typographyValueFallback.title: Typography fallback list
typographyValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of typography values evaluated per Token types §value.
typographyValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

typographyTokenValue.title: Typography token value
typographyTokenValue.description: Typography literal, alias, or fallback list per Typography §typography.
typographyTokenValue.$comment: Typography §typography: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

propertyNames.$comment: Conformance §conformance-classes and Extensibility §extensibility: reserved members beginning with $ are invalid outside schema-defined extension payloads.

typographyType.description: Canonical values such as 'body', 'heading', and 'caption' are registered. Custom values matching this pattern MAY be used; consumers MUST ignore unrecognised types to preserve compatibility.

fontFamily.title: Typography font family
fontFamily.description: Family name string or reference providing the typography font family.
fontFamily.$comment: Typography §typography: fontFamily strings MUST follow CSS <family-name> grammar or reference an existing font token.

lineHeight.description: Baseline-to-baseline distance as a ratio or font-dimension.

letterSpacing.$comment: MUST follow CSS letter-spacing grammar and reuse font-dimension unit conversions.

oneOf.$comment: MUST be the keyword 'normal' per CSS Text Module Level 3 letter-spacing grammar.

wordSpacing.$comment: MUST conform to CSS word-spacing <length-percentage> grammar and platform unit semantics.

oneOf.$comment: MUST be the keyword 'normal' per CSS Text Module Level 3 word-spacing grammar.

fontWeight.$comment: MUST match CSS font-weight absolute or relative productions and map to platform weight APIs.

oneOf.$comment: MUST be within the CSS absolute weight range of 1-1000 and MAY include fractional values for variable fonts.

fontStyle.$comment: MUST conform to CSS font-style grammar and map to native italic traits or the slnt variation axis (css-fonts-4, IOS-FONT-TRAITS, IOS-FONT-VARIATIONS, ANDROID-FONT-SLANT, ANDROID-FONT-VARIATION).

fontVariant.$comment: MUST match the CSS font-variant grammar when present.

fontStretch.$comment: MUST match the CSS font-stretch grammar when present.

textDecoration.title: Text decoration
textDecoration.description: CSS text-decoration shorthand including line, style, colour, and thickness components per Typography §text-decoration.
textDecoration.$comment: Typography §text-decoration: values MUST follow the CSS text-decoration shorthand grammar, including colour keywords and <length-percentage> thickness tokens.

textTransform.title: Text transform
textTransform.description: Keyword list matching the CSS text-transform grammar per Typography §text-transform.
textTransform.$comment: Typography §text-transform: values MUST follow the <text-transform-list> grammar and remain locale-sensitive.

fontFeatures.$comment: MUST contain OpenType feature tags per CSS font-feature-settings and the OpenType registry.

items.$comment: MUST be a four-character OpenType feature tag registered by CSS font-feature-settings or documented by the font.

anyOf.$comment: Single value MUST follow the <length-percentage> grammar defined for CSS border-radius.

x.$comment: Horizontal radius MUST conform to CSS <length-percentage> and native point/density semantics.

y.$comment: Optional vertical radius MUST conform to CSS <length-percentage>; when omitted, consumers reuse the horizontal value.

anyOf.$comment: Encodes the <length-percentage>{1,2} grammar used by border-top-left-radius and related properties.

borderValueEntry.title: Border value entry
borderValueEntry.description: Literal border payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §border tokens.
borderValueEntry.$comment: Token types §border tokens and §value: border tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

borderValueFallback.title: Border fallback list
borderValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of border values evaluated per Token types §value.
borderValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

borderTokenValue.title: Border token value
borderTokenValue.description: Border literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §border tokens.
borderTokenValue.$comment: Token types §border tokens: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

borderType.title: Border context identifier
borderType.description: Platform-qualified border context such as css.border, ios.layer.border, or android.shape.stroke.
borderType.$comment: MUST identify CSS border/outline contexts or native stroke APIs such as CALayer and GradientDrawable.

width.$comment: Width MUST follow the <line-width> grammar, accepting CSS keywords or dimension values that respect point/density conversions for pt, dp, and sp units.

style.title: Border line style
style.description: CSS <line-style> keyword such as solid, dashed, or inset per Token types §border tokens.
style.$comment: Token types §border tokens: style MUST match CSS <line-style> keywords none, hidden, dotted, dashed, solid, double, groove, ridge, inset, or outset (css-backgrounds-3).

strokeStyle.$comment: Optional strokeStyle metadata MUST capture dash, cap, and join semantics compatible with CSS border-image, SVG stroke, CAShapeLayer.lineDashPattern, and Android Paint#setPathEffect.

color.$comment: Border colour MUST conform to CSS <color> values and convert to CGColor or Android colour integers.

anyOf.$comment: Uniform radius MUST follow the border-radius <length-percentage> grammar.
Per-corner entries MUST follow border-radius semantics with names matching physical or logical corners.

strokeStyleValueEntry.title: Stroke style value entry
strokeStyleValueEntry.description: Literal stroke-style payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §stroke-style tokens.
strokeStyleValueEntry.$comment: Token types §stroke-style tokens and §value: strokeStyle tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

strokeStyleValueFallback.title: Stroke style fallback list
strokeStyleValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of stroke-style values evaluated per Token types §value.
strokeStyleValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

strokeStyleTokenValue.title: Stroke style token value
strokeStyleTokenValue.description: Stroke-style literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §stroke-style tokens.
strokeStyleTokenValue.$comment: Token types §stroke-style tokens: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

oneOf.$comment: Numeric dash intervals MUST follow the <number> grammar used by SVG stroke-dasharray and CanvasRenderingContext2D.setLineDash.
Length dash intervals MUST conform to the <length> production accepted by SVG stroke-dasharray and CSS border-image repeat lengths.

dashArray.$comment: Sequence of dash and gap lengths MUST follow SVG stroke-dasharray semantics and map to CAShapeLayer.lineDashPattern and Android DashPathEffect intervals.

oneOf.$comment: Numeric offsets MUST follow the <number> grammar from SVG stroke-dashoffset representing multiples of the stroke width.
Length offsets MUST conform to CSS <length> semantics for stroke-dashoffset and native stroke APIs.

lineCap.$comment: Line caps MUST match the <stroke-linecap> keywords butt, round, or square defined by SVG and Canvas 2D.

lineJoin.$comment: Line joins MUST match the <stroke-linejoin> keywords miter, round, or bevel defined by SVG and Canvas 2D.

miterLimit.$comment: Miter limits MUST be >= 1 following SVG stroke-miterlimit and CanvasRenderingContext2D.miterLimit semantics.

shadowValueEntry.title: Shadow value entry
shadowValueEntry.description: Literal shadow payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §shadow tokens.
shadowValueEntry.$comment: Token types §shadow tokens and §value: shadow tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

shadowValueFallback.title: Shadow fallback list
shadowValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of shadow values evaluated per Token types §value.
shadowValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

shadowTokenValue.title: Shadow token value
shadowTokenValue.description: Shadow literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §shadow tokens.
shadowTokenValue.$comment: Token types §shadow tokens: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

then.$comment: Arrays containing at least one alias or function are treated as fallback chains evaluated in order.

else.title: Shadow layer stack
else.description: Non-empty array of literal shadow layers following CSS <shadow> ordering per Token types §shadow tokens.
else.$comment: Token types §shadow tokens: arrays without alias or function entries represent literal multi-layer shadows.

else.title: Shadow literal or computed value
else.description: Single shadow layer, $ref alias, or function expression per Token types §shadow tokens.
else.$comment: Token types §shadow tokens and §value: non-array values MAY be inline layers, $ref aliases, or function objects.

shadowType.title: Shadow context identifier
shadowType.description: Rendering surface identifier such as css.box-shadow, css.text-shadow, ios.layer, or android.view.elevation.
shadowType.$comment: MUST identify the rendering context defined by CSS <shadow> grammars, UIKit CALayer/NSShadow APIs, or Android View/Paint shadow documentation (e.g. css.box-shadow, css.text-shadow, css.filter.drop-shadow, ios.layer, ios.text, android.view.elevation).

offsetX.$comment: Horizontal offset MUST conform to CSS <length> or platform-native units such as points (pt) and density-independent pixels (dp).

offsetY.$comment: Vertical offset MUST conform to CSS <length> or platform-native units such as points (pt) and density-independent pixels (dp).

blur.title: Shadow blur radius
blur.description: Length measurement describing blur spread per Token types §shadow tokens.
blur.$comment: Blur radius MUST match the <length> position in the CSS <shadow> production or equivalent CALayer.shadowRadius / Paint#setShadowLayer radius semantics.

value.title: Non-negative blur value
value.description: Shadow blur radii MUST be zero or positive per CSS <shadow> grammar.
value.$comment: CSS <shadow> blur radii are non-negative lengths (css-backgrounds-3).

spread.$comment: Optional spread MUST follow the final <length> of CSS <shadow> and is realised via CALayer.shadowPath or Android outline inflation.

color.$comment: Shadow colour MUST conform to CSS <color> values and map to CGColor / Android colour integers.

gradient-line-angle.title: Gradient line orientation
gradient-line-angle.description: CSS linear-gradient line syntax accepting an <angle> or to <side-or-corner> keyword per Token types §gradient tokens.
gradient-line-angle.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens: string angles MUST be a CSS <angle> with units or the 'to <side-or-corner>' grammar (css-images-4).

gradient-position.title: Gradient position
gradient-position.description: CSS <position> tokens composed of keywords, <length-percentage>, or calc-style functions per Token types §gradient tokens.
gradient-position.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens: centre strings MUST follow the CSS <position> grammar used by radial-gradient() and conic-gradient() (css-images-4).

gradient-ending-shape.title: Radial gradient ending shape
gradient-ending-shape.description: CSS radial-gradient() ending shape keyword per Token types §gradient tokens.
gradient-ending-shape.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens: shape MUST be the <rg-ending-shape> keyword circle or ellipse (css-images-3).

color-stop-length-string.title: Color stop length string
color-stop-length-string.description: CSS <color-stop-length> token composed of one or two <length-percentage> entries per Token types §gradient tokens.
color-stop-length-string.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens and css-images-4: stop positions expressed as strings MUST be a single <length-percentage> or a pair separated by ASCII whitespace.

color-hint-length-string.title: Color hint length string
color-hint-length-string.description: CSS <color-hint> token serialized as a single <length-percentage> entry per Token types §gradient tokens.
color-hint-length-string.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens and css-images-4: hint strings MUST be a solitary <length-percentage> expression without an optional second stop.

gradientValueEntry.title: Gradient value entry
gradientValueEntry.description: Literal gradient payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §gradient tokens.
gradientValueEntry.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens and §value: gradient tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

gradientValueFallback.title: Gradient fallback list
gradientValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of gradient values evaluated per Token types §value.
gradientValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

gradientTokenValue.title: Gradient token value
gradientTokenValue.description: Gradient literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §gradient tokens.
gradientTokenValue.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

gradientType.title: Gradient function
gradientType.description: Gradient function name such as linear, radial, or conic per Token types §gradient tokens.
gradientType.$comment: Token types §gradient tokens: gradientType MUST be linear, radial, or conic matching CSS Images Module Level 4 gradient functions and mapping to CAGradientLayer.type or Android gradient shader constructors.

anyOf.$comment: Normalised offsets align with CAGradientLayer.locations and Android shader stop arrays.
Normalised hints map to native midpoint interpolation controls.
MUST conform to the <color-hint> production described in CSS Images Module Level 4.

stops.$comment: Represents the CSS <color-stop-list> grammar and corresponding native stop arrays.

angle.title: Gradient angle
angle.description: Linear gradient line orientation expressed as a CSS <angle> string or numeric degrees per Token types §gradient tokens.

anyOf.$comment: Represents native rotation values interpreted in degrees when numeric.
Unit-square coordinates map to CAGradientLayer start/end points and Android radial or conic gradient centres.

shape.title: Gradient ending shape
shape.description: Radial gradient ending shape keyword such as circle or ellipse per Token types §gradient tokens.

gradientType.$comment: Radial gradients do not accept an initial angle per CSS Images Module Level 4.
Only radial-gradient() and conic-gradient() accept a centre position in CSS Images Module Level 4.
<rg-ending-shape> keywords are valid exclusively on radial-gradient() per CSS Images Module Level 3.

filterValueEntry.title: Filter value entry
filterValueEntry.description: Literal filter payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §filter tokens.
filterValueEntry.$comment: Token types §filter tokens and §value: filter tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

filterValueFallback.title: Filter fallback list
filterValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of filter values evaluated per Token types §value.
filterValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

filterTokenValue.title: Filter token value
filterTokenValue.description: Filter literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §filter tokens.
filterTokenValue.$comment: Token types §filter tokens: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

filterType.title: Filter context identifier
filterType.description: Platform-qualified filter context such as css.filter, ios.cifilter, or android.render-effect.
filterType.$comment: MUST identify the rendering context defined by CSS filter(), Core Image CIFilter pipelines, or Android RenderEffect chains (for example css.filter, ios.cifilter, android.render-effect).

fn.title: Filter function identifier
fn.description: Function name from CSS Filter Effects or a vendor-qualified analogue such as blur, brightness, or ios.cifilter.gaussian-blur.
fn.$comment: MUST reference a filter function from CSS Filter Effects Module Level 1 or its native analogue (for example blur, brightness, drop-shadow).

parameters.$comment: Arguments MUST satisfy the grammar of the referenced filter function (e.g. CSS blur() <length>, brightness() numbers, drop-shadow() <shadow>) and map to CIFilter / RenderEffect parameters.

operations.$comment: Represents the ordered <filter-function-list> grammar from CSS Filter Effects.

opacityValueEntry.title: Opacity value entry
opacityValueEntry.description: Numeric opacity, alias, or computed expression per Token types §opacity.
opacityValueEntry.$comment: Token types §opacity and §value: opacity tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

opacityValueFallback.title: Opacity fallback list
opacityValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of opacity values evaluated per Token types §value.
opacityValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

opacityTokenValue.title: Opacity token value
opacityTokenValue.description: Opacity literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §opacity.
opacityTokenValue.$comment: Token types §opacity: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

opacityType.title: Opacity context identifier
opacityType.description: Platform-qualified opacity context such as css.opacity, ios.uiview.alpha, or android.view.alpha.
opacityType.$comment: MUST name a platform opacity property such as css.opacity (css-color-4#propdef-opacity), ios.uiview.alpha (IOS-UIVIEW-ALPHA), ios.layer.opacity (IOS-CALAYER), or android.view.alpha (ANDROID-VIEW-ALPHA).

oneOf.$comment: Numeric form MUST satisfy the <alpha-value> range defined by CSS Color Module Level 4 (css-color-4#typedef-alpha-value), UIView.alpha (IOS-UIVIEW-ALPHA), and View#setAlpha (ANDROID-VIEW-ALPHA).
String form MUST conform to the CSS <alpha-value> production (css-color-4#typedef-alpha-value).

durationTimeUnit.$comment: MUST use CSS <time> units serialised as s or ms for transition and animation timing APIs (css-values-4#time-value, css-transitions-2, css-animations-2, IOS-CAANIMATION, ANDROID-VALUE-ANIMATOR).

durationFrameCountUnit.$comment: MUST use the frame count keyword defined by CADisplayLink and Choreographer timing APIs (IOS-CADISPLAYLINK, ANDROID-CHOREOGRAPHER).

durationFractionUnit.$comment: MUST use CSS <percentage> serialisation for fraction/progress timelines (css-values-4#percentages, IOS-UIVIEWPROPERTYANIMATOR, ANDROID-OBJECTANIMATOR).

durationValueEntry.title: Duration value entry
durationValueEntry.description: Duration payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §duration.
durationValueEntry.$comment: Token types §duration and §value: duration tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

durationValueFallback.title: Duration fallback list
durationValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of duration values evaluated per Token types §value.
durationValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

durationTokenValue.title: Duration token value
durationTokenValue.description: Duration literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §duration.
durationTokenValue.$comment: Token types §duration: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

durationType.title: Duration context identifier
durationType.description: Platform-qualified duration context such as css.transition-duration, ios.caanimation.duration, or android.value-animator.duration.
durationType.$comment: MUST identify a duration context defined by CSS Transitions/Animations, Core Animation, UIViewPropertyAnimator, or Android animator APIs (for example css.transition-duration, ios.caanimation.duration, android.value-animator.duration, ios.cadisplaylink.frame-count).

unit.$comment: MUST serialise the unit token defined by the referenced duration grammar (css-values-4#time-value, css-values-4#percentages, IOS-CADISPLAYLINK, ANDROID-CHOREOGRAPHER).

then.$comment: Duration contexts MUST encode non-negative CSS <time> values as defined by CSS Values & Units, Core Animation, and Android animator APIs (css-values-4#time-value, css-transitions-2, css-animations-2, IOS-CAANIMATION, ANDROID-VALUE-ANIMATOR).

value.$comment: Non-negative durations matching the CSS <time> production.

then.$comment: Frame-count durations carry platform refresh steps as described by CADisplayLink and Choreographer (IOS-CADISPLAYLINK, ANDROID-CHOREOGRAPHER).

value.$comment: Non-negative integer frame counts from the referenced timing API.

then.$comment: Fraction/progress contexts serialise CSS <percentage> values used by timelines and native animation fractions (css-values-4#percentages, IOS-UIVIEWPROPERTYANIMATOR, ANDROID-OBJECTANIMATOR).

value.$comment: Numeric percentage matching the CSS <percentage> grammar.

easingValueEntry.title: Easing value entry
easingValueEntry.description: Literal easing payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §easing.
easingValueEntry.$comment: Token types §easing and §value: easing tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

easingValueFallback.title: Easing fallback list
easingValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of easing values evaluated per Token types §value.
easingValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

easingTokenValue.title: Easing token value
easingTokenValue.description: Easing literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §easing.
easingTokenValue.$comment: Token types §easing: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

easing.title: Easing payload
easing.description: Reusable timing curve identified by easingFunction per Token types §easing.
easing.$comment: Token types §easing: easingFunction names a CSS <single-easing-function> or native analogue and parameters follow that grammar.

easingFunction.title: Easing function identifier
easingFunction.description: CSS or vendor-qualified easing identifier such as cubic-bezier, steps, ios.spring, or android.spring-force.
easingFunction.$comment: MUST name a CSS <single-easing-function> production or a documented native analogue.

parameters.title: Easing parameters
parameters.description: Ordered arguments consumed by the referenced easingFunction. Omit when the grammar takes no parameters.
parameters.$comment: When present, MUST satisfy the argument grammar defined for the referenced easing function in CSS Easing Functions or platform timing APIs.

parameters.title: cubic-bezier control points
parameters.description: Four-number array [p1x, p1y, p2x, p2y] per CSS Easing Functions §cubic-bezier(). p1x and p2x MUST be within [0, 1].
parameters.$comment: Token types §easing: cubic-bezier() requires four numeric arguments with domain constraints on the x control points (css-easing-1).

parameters.title: steps() arguments
parameters.description: Positive integer step count with optional <step-position> keyword per CSS Easing Functions §steps().
parameters.$comment: Token types §easing: steps() requires a positive integer and optional step-position keyword (css-easing-1).

parameters.title: Spring timing parameters
parameters.description: Four-number array providing positive magnitudes followed by an initial velocity per UISpringTimingParameters and SpringForce.
parameters.$comment: Token types §easing: spring-based easings supply positive magnitude arguments and any real initial velocity (UISpringTimingParameters, SpringForce).

then.$comment: Token types §easing: keyword easings MUST NOT declare parameters.

zIndexValueEntry.title: Z-index value entry
zIndexValueEntry.description: Stacking context magnitude, alias, or computed expression per Token types §z-index.
zIndexValueEntry.$comment: Token types §z-index and §value: z-index tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

zIndexValueFallback.title: Z-index fallback list
zIndexValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of z-index values evaluated per Token types §value.
zIndexValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

zIndexTokenValue.title: Z-index token value
zIndexTokenValue.description: Z-index literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §z-index.
zIndexTokenValue.$comment: Token types §z-index: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

zIndexType.title: Z-index context identifier
zIndexType.description: Platform-qualified stacking context such as css.z-index, ios.calayer.z-position, or android.view.translationz.
zIndexType.$comment: MUST name a stacking context primitive such as css.z-index, ios.calayer.z-position, android.view.z, or android.view.translationz as defined by CSS Positioned Layout Module Level 3 (css-position-3#propdef-z-index), CALayer.zPosition (IOS-CALAYER), and Android View Z APIs (ANDROID-VIEW-SETZ, ANDROID-VIEW-TRANSLATIONZ).

value.$comment: MUST conform to CSS <integer> (css-position-3#propdef-z-index, css-values-4#integer-value), CALayer.zPosition (IOS-CALAYER), or Android View Z APIs (ANDROID-VIEW-SETZ, ANDROID-VIEW-TRANSLATIONZ) depending on the referenced platform.
CSS z-index values MUST be integers per css-position-3#propdef-z-index.

motionValueEntry.title: Motion value entry
motionValueEntry.description: Literal motion payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §motion tokens.
motionValueEntry.$comment: Token types §motion tokens and §value: motion tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

motionValueFallback.title: Motion fallback list
motionValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of motion values evaluated per Token types §value.
motionValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

motionTokenValue.title: Motion token value
motionTokenValue.description: Motion literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §motion tokens.
motionTokenValue.$comment: Token types §motion tokens: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

motionType.title: Motion transform identifier
motionType.description: Platform-qualified transform such as css.translate, ios.catransform3d.rotate, or android.viewpropertyanimator.scalex.
motionType.$comment: MUST name a platform transform such as css.translate, ios.catransform3d.rotate, or android.viewpropertyanimator.scalex as defined by CSS Transforms Module Level 2 (css-transforms-2#transform-functions), Core Animation (IOS-CGAFFINETRANSFORM, IOS-CATRANSFORM3D, IOS-CAKEYFRAMEANIMATION), and Android animation APIs (ANDROID-VIEWPROPERTYANIMATOR, ANDROID-OBJECTANIMATOR).

parameters.$comment: Members MUST align with the grammar of the referenced transform function.

motion-length.$comment: MUST evaluate to a CSS <length-percentage> (css-values-4#typedef-length-percentage) or equivalent platform distance for translation and path coordinates.

motion-angle.$comment: MUST evaluate to a CSS <angle> (css-values-4#angles) compatible with Core Animation and Android rotation APIs.

motion-origin.$comment: Normalised fractions (0-1) representing transform-origin percentages, CALayer.anchorPoint, and View#setPivotX/Y.

axis.$comment: Components describe the rotation vector consumed by rotate3d() (css-transforms-2#funcdef-rotate3d) and CATransform3DRotate.

motion-scale-factor.$comment: Non-negative multiplier matching CSS scale() arguments and native scale factors; negative multipliers remain invalid.

motion-path.$comment: Path definitions align with CSS offset-path path() geometry, CAKeyframeAnimation.path, and android.graphics.Path.

time.$comment: Normalised progress matching CAKeyframeAnimation.keyTimes and ObjectAnimator fractions.

motion-path-position.$comment: Each axis resolves to <length-percentage> coordinates evaluated along the referenced path geometry.

elevationValueEntry.title: Elevation value entry
elevationValueEntry.description: Literal elevation payload, alias, or computed expression per Token types §elevation tokens.
elevationValueEntry.$comment: Token types §elevation tokens and §value: elevation tokens MAY embed direct values, $ref aliases, or functions.

elevationValueFallback.title: Elevation fallback list
elevationValueFallback.description: Ordered fallback list of elevation values evaluated per Token types §value.
elevationValueFallback.$comment: Token types §value: fallback sequences evaluate candidates until one resolves.

elevationTokenValue.title: Elevation token value
elevationTokenValue.description: Elevation literal, alias, or fallback list per Token types §elevation tokens.
elevationTokenValue.$comment: Token types §elevation tokens: tokens MAY specify inline values, references, or fallback arrays.

elevationType.title: Elevation context identifier
elevationType.description: Rendering surface identifier such as css.box-shadow.surface, ios.layer.surface, or android.paint.shadow-layer.surface.
elevationType.$comment: MUST identify the rendering context defined by CSS <shadow> functions, UIKit CALayer/NSShadow properties, or Android elevation/shadow APIs (for example css.box-shadow.surface, ios.layer.surface, android.paint.shadow-layer.surface).

offset.$comment: Vertical offset MUST conform to CSS <length> grammar and map to CALayer.shadowOffset.height, Paint#setShadowLayer dy, or View#setElevation displacement.

blur.title: Elevation blur radius
blur.description: Length measurement describing the ambient blur per Token types §elevation tokens.
blur.$comment: Blur radius MUST match the <length> position in CSS <shadow> and the CALayer.shadowRadius / Paint#setShadowLayer radius semantics.

value.title: Non-negative blur value
value.description: Elevation blur radii MUST be zero or positive per CSS <shadow> grammar.
value.$comment: CSS <shadow> blur radii are non-negative lengths (css-backgrounds-3).

color.$comment: Shadow colour MUST conform to CSS <color> values and map to CGColor / Android colour integers used for Paint#setShadowLayer or elevation overlays.

lifecycle-metadata.title: Lifecycle telemetry requirements
lifecycle-metadata.description: Ensures $lastUsed timestamps and $usageCount counters follow Metadata §table requirements.

$lastUsed.title: $lastUsed not before $lastModified
$lastUsed.description: $lastUsed MUST be on or after $lastModified when both fields are present.

then.$comment: $lastUsed requires a recorded usage count greater than zero.

$usageCount.description: $usageCount MUST be a positive integer when $lastUsed is present.
$usageCount.title: $usageCount for used tokens

then.$comment: $usageCount = 0 indicates no recorded usage, so $lastUsed MUST be omitted.
Recorded usage counts greater than zero require a companion $lastUsed timestamp.

trimmedString.title: Trimmed string
trimmedString.description: Non-empty string without leading or trailing whitespace per Metadata §metadata.
trimmedString.$comment: Metadata table: strings such as $author MUST be trimmed.

hashString.title: Hash string
hashString.description: Stable identifier with no whitespace per Metadata §metadata.
hashString.$comment: Metadata table: $hash MUST NOT contain whitespace.

tags.title: Tag list
tags.description: Array of unique trimmed classification strings per Metadata §metadata.
tags.$comment: Metadata table: $tags MUST contain unique trimmed strings.

function.title: Function expression
function.description: Computed value wrapper with a function name and optional parameters per Token types §value.
function.$comment: Token types §value: $value MAY be a function object with fn and optional parameters members.

fn.title: Function identifier
fn.description: Function name such as calc, clamp, or platform-specific identifiers per Token types §value.

parameters.title: Function parameters
parameters.description: Ordered list of literals, references, nested functions, or arrays per Token types §value. When omitted, consumers treat the list as empty per Token types §value.
parameters.$comment: Token types §value: parameters MAY be omitted when the referenced grammar takes no arguments; omitted parameters default to an empty array.

function-parameter.title: Function parameter
function-parameter.description: Literal, reference, nested function, array, or object argument accepted by function expressions per Token types §value.
function-parameter.$comment: Token types §value: parameters MAY include literals, $ref aliases, nested functions, or arrays.

extensions.title: Extensions map
extensions.description: Namespaced metadata keyed by reverse-DNS identifiers per Format and serialisation §$extensions.
extensions.$comment: Format and serialisation §$extensions: keys MUST use lower-case reverse-DNS identifiers.

propertyNames.$comment: Extension identifiers MUST be lower-case reverse-DNS strings.
